field.name: MON_CNT
field.description: These bits give the value of the Months Counter.\n Valid Values are 1..12 => Jan..Dec

field.name: YROFST
field.description: Year Offset Count Value\n These bits indicate the offset in years from the base year (hard coded as 2112) and do not show the actual year value. This is a signed value. Valid values are 128 to 127. With the Base Year as 2112 and if the value of YEAR field is 0x10, the actual year will be 2112 + 16 = 2128

field.name: DAY_CNT
field.description: Days Counter Value.\n Valid values are 1..31

field.name: DOW

field.name: MIN_CNT

field.name: HOUR_CNT

field.name: SEC_CNT
field.description: Seconds Counter Value\n Valid count values are 0 to 59

field.name: ALM_MATCH

field.name: DST_EN
field.description: Daylight Saving Enable.\n The date and time for daylight saving changes are stored in the Daylight Saving Registers. These registers can be changed when this bit is 0. Once this bit is set, those registers cannot be changed and when time and date match the values in those registers, daylight adjustment will happen. To disable Daylight Saving function, this bit should be set to 0

field.name: SWR

register.name: TAMPER_QUEUE

field.name: TAMPER_DATA
field.description:
Tamper type stamp and pin number information register
 The complete tamper time stamp and status information can be obtained by making two read accesses to this register:
 The first read gives the following information:
 - TAMPER_DATA[4:0] = Hour
 - TAMPER_DATA[9:5] = Day
 - TAMPER_DATA[13:10] = Month
 - TAMPER_DATA[15:14] = 00
 The second read gives the remaining information, that is:
 - TAMPER_DATA[5:0] = seconds
 - TAMPER_DATA[11:6] = minutes
 - TAMPER_DATA[14:12] = Tamper Index, that is, index of tamper status bits from 0 to 3
 - TAMPER_DATA[15] = 0
 NOTE: The year value can be obtained by reading the year counter register

field.name: WAKEUP_MODE
